package.name: MacOS Microsoft Word
package.releaseNotes: • Shortcuts now available for MacOS. • Notification emails for mentions, tasks, comments, and replies will now contain context previews even when the source document is encrypted, and the email will inherit the document's security policies.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft Excel
package.releaseNotes: • Shortcuts now available for MacOS. • Users can now sync responses on Mac create a new Microsoft Form directly within an Excel workbook, linking the form to the workbook seamlessly.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft PowerPoint
package.releaseNotes: Fix support for connected services when turning off the Download Content privacy setting.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft Outlook
package.releaseNotes: • Copilot Command Center: a centralized interface that consolidates Copilot features like summarization, drafts, schedule, etc. into a single, accessible entry point. It dynamically adapts based on account eligibility, ensuring users can access relevant Copilot powered features right when they need them. • Mail merge account setting: users can now choose a specific account—such as a shared mailbox or a non-default account—as the sender for Merge to Email in Word for Mac, instead of always using the default account. • Copilot Attachment Summaries - Users can now generate Copilot summaries for PDFs, Word, and PowerPoint attachments from the attachment well or from the summarize card. This feature helps users quickly grasp key content without opening the file. • Calendar Sharing for On-Premises Mailboxes: Users can now share calendars from Exchange On-Premises accounts. • Add-ins for On-Premises Mailboxes: Users can now use add-ins, such as Zoom & Webex, with Exchange On-Premises accounts. • Up next in menu bar: Users now have the option to configure the visibility of upcoming meetings & appointments in the menu bar via the My Day settings.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft OneNote
package.releaseNotes:
This month’s update is bug fixes only.
Thanks for using OneNote! We listened to your feedback and updated the application with optimizations to help improve your note taking experience.
Having trouble? Send feedback in the app by clicking on the smiley face in the top-right of the app. Have an idea? Add to our feature suggestion box at https://aka.ms/onenotefeedback

package.name: MacOS Microsoft OneDrive
package.releaseNotes: Thank you for using OneDrive. We are always looking to update OneDrive to bring you the latest performance improvements and bug fixes for the best experience.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft Windows App
package.releaseNotes:
In this release we made the following updates:
• Fixed an issue that prevented switching focus between local and remote apps. • Improved the reliability of mouse cursor shape updates. • Resolved problems with the Quick Launcher filter. • Reworked the UI to better handle empty states in the Devices and Apps tabs. • Cleaned up the text for some menu bar and pop-up menus entries. • Resolved connectivity issues affecting users in Zscaler-protected environments.
If you encounter any errors, you can contact us via Help > Submit Feedback.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft To-Do
package.releaseNotes: We fixed some bugs to improve the app experience.

package.name: MacOS Microsoft Azure VPN Client
package.releaseNotes: Added auto reconnect on VPN connections for intermittent/ server failures. Added notification which notifies user to install rosetta in case its not installed in arm machines. Minor bug fixes and performance improvements.
